comment: Instructor Sooh-Rhee was very enthusiastic about the courses content, making it very enjoyable to learn about American Government. She shows a clear passion for political science, and has a caring personality towards her students. Her coursework is consistent with a module due every week, no surprises on whats due or when its due.

Shes very accessible, responds to emails, & very clear with her directions. If you're ever confused, always shoot her an email first & dont even stress about it. I felt as though I actually learned this semester despite covid, & I really appreciated her help through last year. She's a good teacher & extra credit will help you.

One big policy paper, 10-12 pages straight forward though just takes some time, Weekly readings/quizzes/assignments. If you read everything thoroughly and take some notes and keep track of all the vocab from the textbook the assignments/quizzes will be easy as well as the final. She is awesome nice and the best type of professor in my opinion!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Really easy and interesting online class. Completely asynchronous and easy to follow along. I gave this professor a 4 just because I never met them or heard their voice. It was a bit detached, and I would've enjoyed getting to know them more. Kinda scary because the only test was the final, but it is open book. All graded assignments are open book.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Graded by few things

comment: I love Professor Ryu. She is honestly so helpful and her class is extremely easy if you stay on top of your work. Each week there are 5 assignments due (extremely easy) and she is very lenient on grading. She is very responsive and never takes long to give feedback on grades or emails. I usually receive her feedback within an hour after submitting
Took this class completely online but there are about 5 assignments that you must complete each week: 2 quizzes and 3 writing assignments. Not difficult at all.

AMAZING! Weekly essay quiz, mini quiz, and key terms quiz. Also Article summary. All from the textbook and super easy. Actually an interesting class so enjoyable to do. Foreign Policy Paper and Final are the only two major grades.

Three online tests and weekly writing assignment based on an article of your choice. Super nice professor who really wants to get to know the class. The textbook was technically required, but I only used it to look up a few test questions. Super lecture heavy, and attendance is graded. Because attendance is mandatory, she doesn't post notes online.

Professor Ryu is a good professor but (as everyone does) she has some flaws. She is very awkward and, at times, focuses more on connecting with her students than teaching the course. However, it is a fairly simple class and she teaches what she needs to well.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Good teacher and an easy A. The tests are ONLINE. You can use your notes so take diligent notes. Mandatory attendance but only counts for like 10% of grade. Easy weekly summaries and 3 tests. She handled the transition well and though she talks a lot, I still enjoyed her class. It was the first time I felt appreciated as a student- don't need book.

She is a fun professor but this class was hard for no reason. My entire class struggled on the test. You have 3 test and weekly summaries which are short and easy to complete. Her lectures are not in-depth and only cut the surface. You also do get graded for attendance.

One of the nicest and funniest professors. Her lectures are very easy to follow. Your grade is made up of about 3 tests and you have to turn in a news article summary every week ,which is not hard at all.

Professor Ryu is a great professor. She really knows the material and loves hearing our interpretation of the material. She urges us to interact in small groups to discuss the material on somedays and really urges us to read the material and extra readings. She has a great sense of humor, and I enjoyed having her as my professor.

Dr. Ryu really knows her material! She is very willing to help where you may struggle! JUST ASK or EMAIL. Use your resources, the textbook is mandatory! GO to class everyday and take thorough notes you'll make an A! She is a fair grader on policy papers, etc. She does offer extra credit opportunities! Be prepared to put in the effort and time!

GREAT professor. super nice and hilarious. took notes from power points. They aren't boring bc her personality makes class fun. u also get in groups and discuss questions she asks out loud. every Thursday current event due only one page MLA and super easy. LOVED HER. quizzes are STRAIGHT word for word from powerpoint notes (which she lets u use)
